channel.title: No-Ip hosting problem
channel.description:
Well, there is some kind of error, i did wat i had to do to host it, but it wont work somehow. And yes, i portforwarded already
So im asking you guys, could someone host a no-ip for me?
I would be very thankfull.

item.title: No-Ip hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“Mod Foxen, post:7, topic:220172”]Use hamachi if no-ip doesn’t work.[/quote]Wrong, he said he could not get No-IP to work. That means he doesn’t have a DNS for his private server. All you can do for now is use your real IP to enter your server(only for you it can be blank or 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0)

Read full topic

well do u still have the port same on serevr as when you portforwaded, nd also do you still have the download, the no-ip duc, and is it checked, and have you checked mabey the parents got rid of your port forwarding, if not then I really do not know,

but i do not think anyone well host for you unless you probably pay em off.

And chill out man, no need to snap cause u hit a little bump in the road

item.title: No-Ip hosting problem
item.dc:creator: @moparRuler moparRuler
item.description:
@moparRuler wrote:

First you need to go to the router

To put router in default settings, depending on router their should be a hole or a button on back you can hold for a minute that well reset passwords to default settings, but keep internet settings same Enjoy

then it might be under gaming (depend on router) then port farwarding

Put ur port for start and stop , then name it w/e u want and do

Then run, then cmd then ipconfig find ur ip and put the last 3 digits in.

Once that is all done go to no-ip.com make acc, add a host, do nothing else but add a host

Then once all that is done go to downloads on no-ip.com, click download

Then logon check the name of the host u added, and it should be running now

Hope this helps you

Read full topic
